title: What will happen if Google stops working for a day? - Quora

response.answer_text: Let’s ignore Google Search, Gmail, and the other G-suite services for now. They’ll go down, we’re looking at a total cost of billions, most likely, but that’s not the fun part. The fun part is the secondary effects. A lot of bandwidth will be freed up. In North America, DPI vendor Sandvine claims YouTube accounts for 17% of internet bandwidth (at peak hours). Tossing in a percentage more to be generous, and that means that the available bandwidth on the internet would increase by a fifth… … if Google wasn’t actually also an enormous CDN, with at least a 25% of all the websites loading at least data from Google’s CDN. Google hosts copies of stuff like jQuery, web fonts, common libraries, and so on. Without these, modern web pages would break, or, at least, take minutes to load even though we suddenly had the bandwidth. Well, that’s even assuming we’d reach those pages… … as Google also happens to be an enormous public DNS provider. In 2012, they noted they were resolving 70 billion requests per day. In 2014, that had grown to 400 billion. Google is one of the fastest DNS resolvers, in large part because of its own, private internet backbone and massive datacenter presence. Many cloud-hosted services default to using 8.8.8.8 (and so does Chrome, secretly), so if your DNS query to find the webpage succeeded, the page’s server itself might be collapsing. So, to recap, our post-googpocalyptic hellscape would be a slow-loading internet that, ironically, has lots of spare bandwidth. Microsoft, Amazon would be fine. Lots of websites would no longer need ad blockers, as a large proportion of the ads are now offline. But things would start breaking. Update software would start failing. The massive amount of backlogged data trying to reach Google servers might even prevent them from being brought online in an orderly fashion, with Google instead rationing their access on a prioritised basis. Then it’d come up. The news would have fun with it. The stocks would fluctuate. Google’s shares would fall significantly. People would swear that this shall never happen again, and Google’s share of sites they host might fall temporarily. A number of startups will appear offering Google/Amazon/Microsoft independence. But, at the end of the day, Google will stand, weakened but not toppled, their quest to assimila… I mean index the internet delayed… for now.

Googled “what will happen if Google stops working for a day”. Played with Dino for while before I realized. Google is down! What an irony.Took out my Android phone. Ok Google! Hello??? Siri?? Nada. Still Android. Worth a try though.$2.7B in fines. And Google is down. Can’t find a better time. Well played Google. Well played indeed!Bing? Nope. Never forgiven Bing Rewards! At least cute wallpapers. Moving on.Back in India, Papu is bashing Modi, for it was Google’s feeble attempt at Make in India. Did this guy really go to Harvard? In another world, Kejri’s ice-cream reviews are still trending on Twitter.YouTube is not down! Reddit guys are busy playing with the volume slider. But usual day for my teammates, with every movie universally accessible. Definitely not evil, Google.Hail Stack Overflow! Want to make this your home page? Oh yes, please.Quora. Why is Google down? Why is Google down? Why is Google down? 27182818 views. I get it. Google is down. But I have to answer all that?? Stop with the A2A!Somewhere in the world, people are missing their flights. Suicides are up. Porn is down. Travel plans are a mess. Assignments are a miss. But Zuck is at bliss!And Google is back! That felt like a lifetime. Now back to Trump.

Two possible outcomes: Usama Siddiqui brings up a good point that there are alternates like Bing but if you have ever truly used Bing, you will see it is an inferior product. Without the access to information readily at our fingertips, the world would go mad and anarchy would fill the streets. People would loot the streets since we no longer have the time or patience to look information up at the library and reference other works. We would rely on the knowledge of our peers and ourselves rather than being able to ask Google. Chaos would fill every level and every position. Even the President wouldn't be able to make his everyday decisions and most likely launch all of our nukes to create panic in the world while sending reinforcements to the Google campus to get the problem fixed so they could reverse the launching of the nukes. Second possibility, people move to Bing and learn to deal with it. And maybe a couple of people go to the library.

As smart phones hang, your mind will also hang. But it will not happen in future, but if it happens, then in this post today, we are going to know Worst Possibilities from something similar. Whether we want it or not, we are using Google in Direct or Indirect way. But suppose we will not but believe it anyway. What will happen if Google suddenly stops its services? All of Android makes Os just and only Google. And if Google is closed then you will have to switch from Android to iPhone.  Android is an Open Source Operating System. So we could download whatever you want here, but now leave the movie and song in Apple, then you will have to purchase it to use a small application of 2 mb. Number 3 – Google Search Friends there are daily Approx 580 Crore Searches on Google. That is, Google has created a Monopoly in the search engine. However yaahoo and Bing is also a search engine. But all of us were using Google till now. And if Google is closed. So, if these 580 crore searches happen on any other search engine, then that search engine will crash. And one more thing, if you have been using Google Chrome till now, then Google is definitely tracking you.  I tell a Fun Fast friends, even if Google is completely closed, it still has no effect on China. Do you know why ?? Because Google is not used in China. There they have made their own search engine and other things. Number 2 – Google Map  Today we all find out everything from Google map instead of asking for address from any other person in any other city. But we will not be able to do this after Google services are discontinued. And you have to depend on someone else for any address without Google map. And in such a situation, a big question arises on your Safty and Security. Number 1 – Google G-Mail Friends, all of us have made our emails on Google. And the mobile phone of all of us is also based on the same id, so first of all our winning works are official works. They will be closed, besides there are many such companies. Which relays only on Google's Trusted Applications for its working operations. All your data will be completely blocked from Google Drive.  Friends, this is just a few examples. Apart from what I am giving you, Google can cause a lot of havoc, but if you are thinking this. If the Internet will stop after its Google shutdown, it will not happen at all. Because Google is also a part of the Internet and not the entiInternetnet. Read Article

Those with a dire need would just 'Bing', and the rest, could just go out for a walk in the sun and get some fresh air. Sure, it will be a handicap. Most will miss their emails and drive data for sure. But, remember, there are still a LOT of folks who manage to live on without their daily supply of electricity and water, at many places. Enterprises would take a big hit on the day, with engineers not having code snippets to copy-paste from, and MBAs without access to data to use in their PPTs, but overall, Google itself is just a relatively lesser need, especially given there are alternatives in each of its products really. The world would just go on.

The whole Internet will know that this guy has been waiting all this long for you to know that he is waiting for you.  Look at his happy face on http://duckduckgo.com. You can learn more about him here: Google. Welcome to the other side Edit:Mr. Terry Lambert points on the comment section that our smiley duckey would be down also if Google were down. I did not know that they use Google cloud infrastructure.

Every day that passes the critical it would be. Besides B2C services and a general internet chaos, very happy Bing and very very sad Google shareholders, thousands of business would disappear for few days. Every day Google Cloud grows it’s customer base, it’s nowhere even close to Amazon, but a lot a businesses use it. If Google goes down, for example, your company’s software would stop working and depending how it’s strcutured, there maybe not much Any IT department could do besides waiting.

Personally, if the entire company stopped functioning (including all services like Gmail), my productivity would drop to zero for pretty much the whole day. If you just mean search though that would just be a minor inconvenience. I'd probably just use Bing for the day. World wide, I imagine the impact would be similar. Some people would hardly notice the difference, but companies that use Google apps would be effectively out of commission for the day. Anything hosted on Google app engine would also be down, so a lot of other services would be effected. As long as it was only for a day though I doubt the impact would be life-altering.

If google went down for a day it would cost millions. One thing is the APPS the other would be searches would be sent to bing or yahoo. I doubt bing and yahoo could survive the burdan of google searchers. Bing and Yahoo would crash. I think people would resort to other engines that would crash too. Social media like facebook would also crash. So then Google would be the first to get back up and then crash because of the broken Bing and Yahoo. I am not sure if the internet would ever get back to normal.

But for instance if it happens than at time there will be apocalypse, because all the IT company uses the server of google, and all the system of world work online it may be encrypted or not. There will be the huge amount of loss in terms of business and in the man kind. There will be rumours that can not be checked online, there will be the no law and regulation. The loss will be huge which can not be describe in words. Hope these will never will happen

Google is censored in China, so as an American who visits China frequently, I can answer this question. We use Bing. (ps. Facebook, YouTube, Wikipedia, and a whole host of other sites are also censored in China. It makes doing actual work more difficult, but for everyday things, not a big deal.)

Easy answer: income loss. Not only Google relies on its servers to produce income. Minor companies and entrepreneurs rely on Google services to serve their clients. Having no service for an entire day can represent a major loss in their revenue. For the public that gives Google services a personal use, it will represent an incapacity to be in contact with their social circle. Can you imagine how hard this would be for a person addicted to the phone? Either way, Google’s reputation can suffer damage for its incapacity to ensure a constant (and safe) service to all the publics it serves.

If Google server won’t break down, I think it is okay if they took one day off. They have been working so hard. However, if Google server broke down, I would say that other browsers will be very happy. I am talking about Yahoo, Bing and others. I will tell you that they will be very happy with the amount of data and statistic that happened on the day. Though it is one day, the level of satisfaction is like getting winter on summer seasons.

People will use Bing and other available alternatives. There are alternatives available. If somehow most of the Google services goes down,there are services available from Microsoft that will serve as the best alternative.
